intro: Daviesia alata, commonly known as the slender Daviesia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions with a Mediterranean climate. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions. Daviesia alata is also known for its role in supporting local wildlife, particularly insects and birds.
